        The Startup Place Limited is a Business Consulting firm with key focus on Startup Development, Digital Marketing and Business Growth. We pull a team of passionate entrepreneurs and consultant about helping you start, grow and scale your business.

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time (Hybrid)

	This is a full-time hybrid role for a Social Media Officer located in Lagos, with the flexibility to work remotely on occasion.
	The Social Media Officer will be responsible for creating and managing engaging social media content, executing social media marketing strategies, optimizing platforms for maximum reach, and maintaining consistent communication with the audience across various channels.
	Additional responsibilities include analyzing performance metrics, staying informed on industry trends, and collaborating with the team to ensure an effective online presence.


Qualifications


	Proficiency in Social Media Content Creation and Writing skills
	Experience with Social Media Marketing and Social Media Optimization (SMO)
	Strong Communication skills for engaging with audiences and teams
	Familiarity with analytics tools and the ability to interpret performance metrics

	Relevant experience or a degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is a plus.

title: Job Openings at Baobab Microfinance Bank
content:
Baobab Microfinance Bank is an investment company whose mission is to create a group of leading microfinance banks and finance companies in at least 15 countries by 2015 that will provide financial services and savings products to entrepreneurs who lack access to the traditional financial sector. Baobab was created in July 2005 by PlaNet Finance, and other investors including International Finance Corporation, AXA Belgium, and Societe Generale, with the European Investment Bank, the French Development Agency and Developing World Markets Joining later.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Experienced Loan Officer
     

            
    



Job Location:  Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time
Reporting to: Branch Supervisor

Main Responsibilities


	Promote/Market Baobab’s products to prospective clients
	Visit and evaluate potential client businesses
	Visit client’s personal house
	Visit co-debtor, guarantor’s house and businesses
	Analyze financial data of client’s businesses
	Analysis of quantitative and qualitative data of client businesses and households
	Prepare loan documents for credit committee
	Present loan files to credit committee
	Enter Loan files in the MIS.
	Conduct monitoring visits to business and households
	Follow- up on loan repayment
	Manage loan recovery from active and write-off client until the last kobo
	Assess the impact of loan before renewal
	Deposit Mobilization
	Any other task as directed by your line supervisor.


Education


	B.Sc, HND Minimum
	Fluent in English (Written/spoken)
	Detail oriented
	Target oriented
	Articulate and well spoken
	High level of integrity
	Dynamic and motivated and individuals who like to work outdoors
	Must have completed NYSC
	Basic Knowledge in accounting, finance and mathematics
	Previous work Experience or training In sales (Preferably in an MfB or a commercial Bank).


Application Closing Date: 22nd February, 2026.

Click Here to Apply Online

Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

 

 

2.) Product Marketing Manager

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Direct Reporting Line: Head of Growth (User Acquisition & Retention)

Role Overview


	The Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing go-to-market (GTM) strategies for Baobab Nigeria’s suite of financial products, including Instant Card, USSD, Merchant Acquiring, Agency Banking, digital savings, digital lending, and any new products the company may launch.
	You will bridge the gap between product, marketing, and commercial teams ensuring every product is well-positioned, understood, and adopted by the right audience.


Key Responsibilities
Strategy & Positioning:


	Develop and refine product positioning, value propositions, and messaging thatresonate with target audiences.
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis to guide product differentiationand market entry strategies.
	Define customer segments and key use cases for each product line.


Go-to-Market (GTM) Planning:


	Lead cross-functional GTM launches for new products and features, ensuringalignment across product, marketing, and sales teams.
	Develop and manage integrated marketing campaigns that drive awareness,activation, and adoption.
	Support the development of marketing assets (videos, landing pages, productsheets, social ads, etc.) in collaboration with the creative and growth teams.


Product Growth & Optimization:


	Collaborate with the Growth and Product teams to track adoption metrics, userbehaviour, and retention performance.
	Identify opportunities to enhance product experience through feedback, insights,and user data.
	Develop lifecycle communication strategies to increase engagement and reducechurn.


Stakeholder Management:


	Partner with internal teams (Growth, Tech, Risk, Sales, and Customer Experience) to ensure consistent product communication and alignment.
	Support field and agency banking teams with product training, marketing materials,and merchant engagement tools.
	Collaborate with Baobab Group’s regional marketing and innovation teams toensure alignment with group strategy.


Insights & Reporting:


	Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) across awareness, activation, andretention funnels.
	Produce regular product marketing reports with actionable insights andrecommendations.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Economics, or a related field (MBAor equivalent is a plus).
	3–6 years of experience in product marketing, growth marketing, or digital financial services.
	Proven experience launching or managing fintech or banking products.
	Strong understanding of the Nigerian financial ecosystem, customer behavior, anddigital channels.
	Excellent communication, storytelling, and analytical skills.
	Proficiency in data analytics, campaign performance tools, and CRM systems.


What We Offer


	A dynamic and inclusive work environment focused on innovation and impact.
	Opportunity to shape the future of financial inclusion in Nigeria.
	Competitive compensation and career development within the Baobab Group.


Application Closing Date: 8th February, 2026.

Click Here to Apply Online

Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

 

 

3.) Scrum Master

Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to:Head, IT PMO & Change management

Job Summary


	As a Scrum Master, you will be a facilitator and coach for the development team, guiding them in adhering to Agile principles and the Scrum framework.
	Your mission is to create a productive environment where the team can deliver high-quality software products by removing impediments, fostering collaboration, and ensuring continuous improvement.


Responsibilities


	Facilitate Scrum ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
	Coach and guide the Scrum team on adhering to Agile principles and practices, and ensure they understand and follow Scrum theory, guidelines, and practices.
	Help the Product Owner manage the product backlog effectively.
	Remove any impediments or blockers that are hindering the team's progress.
	Shield the team from external distractions and interruptions.
	Promote a collaborative and transparent team environment.
	Liaise with stakeholders to improve visibility and clarity about the teams work.
	Encourage continuous learning and improvement within the team.
	Resolve conflicts within the team and promote constructive disagreement.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in Project Management with minimum of 3 years of experience in managing software development teams using Agile Methodology.
	Solid knowledge of Agile frameworks and methodology, such as Scrum or Kanban.
	Agile Scrum Master Certification (e.g., CSM, PSM II) is a plus.
	Demonstrated leadership and management experience.
	Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving aptitude.
	Proficiency in servant-leadership, conflict resolution, empathy, and emotional intelligence.
	Status: Local contract with Baobab Microfinance Bank, Nigeria.


Application Closing Date: 8th February, 2026.

Click Here to Apply Online

Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

     

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "Lopterra is a unique training and consultancy organization with offices in Lagos, Nigeria and Johannesburg, South Africa. Our goal is to provide exceptionally services that meets or exceed our clients expectation.

An engineering project company with expertise in renewable energy, Power Electronic, HVAC and Electrical services delivering bespoke solutions across various sectors of Nigeria and West Africa Sub-Region, Covering Telecommunication, Hospitality, Transportation, Real Estate, Agriculture, Oil and Gas, Health Care and Government Infrastructure.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja,&nbsp;Lagos

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented HR officer to join our our organization.
	As an HR officer, you will be an integral part of our team, providing comprehensive HR support and services to our company.
	You will play a critical role in supporting our Human Resources department in various administrative tasks, functions and contribute to the overall efficiency of the HR department.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources:


	Review and implement HR policies and procedures in line with company goals and labour laws.
	Manage end-to-end recruitment, selection, and onboarding processes.
	Coordinate the biannual performance appraisal and support performance improvement initiatives.
	Conduct Training Needs Analysis (TNA) and implement staff training and development programs.
	Handle employee relations, grievances, and disciplinary processes professionally and confidentially.
	Maintain and update employee records, contracts, and HR database (manual and electronic).
	Support payroll and benefits administration, ensuring compliance with statutory remittances (NSITF, ITF, PENCOM, etc.).
	Organize employee engagement and wellness activities to foster collaboration and inclusion.


Administrative Support:


	Provide administrative assistance to management and departmental heads.
	Assist in ensuring efficient office operations, procurement of office supplies, and vendor coordination.
	Prepare and organize company documentation for client audits, certifications, and renewals.
	Assist in planning company meetings, workshops, and trainings.


Bidding &amp; Compliance Support:


	Assist in preparing tender and bid submissions for private, governmental, and international organizations (e.g., UN, NGOs).
	Ensure timely renewal and documentation of statutory and company certifications required for eligibility in bids.
	Support the collation of prequalification documents, staff CVs, and technical submissions for tender applications.
	Coordinate with relevant departments to ensure compliance with bid requirements and deadlines


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2&ndash; 3 years of hands-on HR experience, preferably in a project-based or technical environment.
	Certification with the Chartered Institute of Personnel Management (CIPM) or equivalent is an advantage.
	Solid understanding of Nigerian labour laws, HR best practices, and administrative management.
	Experience supporting bid or tender documentation is a plus.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and HRIS tools.
	Demonstrated integrity, attention to detail, and ability to multitask under minimal supervision.


Why work with us


	Salary: N150,000 monthly (net).
	Culture of Excellence: Our company fosters a culture of excellence where employees are encouraged to innovate, collaborate, and strive for continuous improvement.
	Opportunities for Growth: Joining our team atmeans gaining access to a wealth of opportunities forprofessional growth and advancementwithin the rapidly expanding renewable energy sector.
	As part of our dynamic organization, you&rsquo;ll work with a diverse portfolio of clients across various industries from manufacturing and real estate to agriculture and technology all striving to make the transition to sustainable energy solutions.
	Strong Purpose and Values: Our company is driven by a strong sense of purpose and a set of values that guide everything we do. We are passionate about making a difference in the world and are committed to conducting business ethically, responsibly, and sustainably.
	Strong Community: Our workplace is also our professional family. We look out for our team.
